questions.name: Access control policies are enforced everywhere in Pega Platform, not just within the UI, including the following three areas
Access control policies can be defined only for these three classes.
Access Deny records only manage actions for what?

options.answer: Access Deny records only manage actions on class instances, such as opening cases or running reports. You cannot use them to deny access to tools or individual records explicitly

questions.name:
An access group includes three access roles.
1. Role A allows users to run reports.
2. Role D denies users the ability to run reports.
3. Role O allows users to view reports.
Based on permissions allocated to the three roles in this access group, which user can run reports?
- All users in the access group except for those in role D can run reports.
- All users in the access group can run reports
- All users in the access group except roles A and O can run reports.

options.answer: When an access group lists more than one role, Pega applies the most permissive setting across all of the listed roles.

questions.name: Before creating an archive file, do the following things to ensure that the file is complete and correct (4 things)

options.answer: Associate your data records (operator IDs, access groups, database tables, and databases) with rulesets; this ensures all the data records required by your application are included in the archive file
Make sure all rules are checked in so that the rulesets are complete and current
In most cases, lock application rulesets included in the package to help ensure no changes occur to the app rulesets during the migration
Merge branched rulesets and remove the branches from the application if you are exporting the application to a production system

questions.name: By default, how long does the system lock a case?

options.answer: by default, the system locks the case for 30 minutes or until the user submits or closes the case, whichever comes first.

questions.name: By default, offline mobile synchronization includes which rules and excludes which rules?

options.answer: Includes rules explicitly referenced in the UI or process.

Data pages can be simulated by what three things?
Definition for data access pattern 'reference'

options.answer: The reference pattern allows an application to use data without adding that data to the data model for the application until the user chooses which data should be stored in the cases data model.

Example would be a control drop-down containing data that is being referenced by an external source. This data is not actually part of the case data model, it's just being referenced elsewhere. When the user selects a value from the drop-down, that value then get copied to the cases data model
